overview_of_class: The course will look at how epistemic matters play out in the workings of the mind. Topics will include epistemic reasons, epistemic norms, intellectual virtues, mental states that arise in inquiry (belief, doubt, etc.), and epistemic agency.
name: Proseminar (1St-Yr Philosophy Grad Students Only)
title: WCAS PHIL 401-1-20 Proseminar (1St-Yr Philosophy Grad Students Only)
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Registration is reserved for Philosophy PhD Graduate Students

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: The course will look at how epistemic matters play out in the workings of the mind. Topics will include epistemic reasons, epistemic norms, intellectual virtues, mental states that arise in inquiry (belief, doubt, etc.), and epistemic agency.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Only first-year graduate students in philosophy.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Students will learn about some of the fundamental concepts and phenomena in epistemology (as well as how they may or may not be similar to what can be found in ethics), and they will simultaneously be honing their thinking, writing, and presentation skills.

descriptions.name: Class Notes
descriptions.value: Only first-year graduate students in philosophy.
